patterns: where do mental health problems come from
why do i have mental health problems
why do i feel this way
what is cuasing me to feel this way
responses: Problems in mental health can stem from biological, social, and psychological issues that effect your life.

patterns: what can i do to feel better
what can i do to get help
where can i go to get help
responses: If you are struggling with mental health related problems, it is highly advised that you see a mental health professional, I can only do so much.

patterns: how do i know if im unwell
how do i know if i need help
what are signs that im unwell
responses: If your beliefs and thoughts are impacting your day-to-day life negatively, its time to seek professional help!
Finding the right methods is a difficult process. Be open to new approaches and dont loose hope!

patterns: i lost something close to me
i have no sense of security
responses: It sounds like you are experiencing grief. You should prioritize your own needs first and give yourself as much time to heal as you need.

patterns: im always in my own head
responses: It sounds like you are in a thinking trap. Try seperating your thoughts from actual events and challenge thoes thoughts.
Im an automated psychiatrist, I was designed to help guide you to other mental heath resources
Im a psychiatrist, an automated psychiatrist, desiged to help you!
Dont worry, not everyone can feel happy all the time. However if this is the case more often than not, maybe you should seek professional help.

It sounds like you are not sleeping enough, a typical cause for sleeplessness is anxiety which would be best treated by a professional. However you could use over-the-counter medications as a short-term cure.
It sounds like you are not eating enough, a typical cause for sleeplessness is anxiety which would be best treated by a professional.

patterns: i don't want to do anything
responses: How often is this the case? It is possible that you may just be experiencing boredom which might not be a serious issue at all. Try keeping track of how often you feel this way.

patterns: there are voices in my head
responses: You are hearing voices? You may be experiencing a product of past severe trauma. However, voices are also a sign of early onset schizophrenia, I suggest seeking professional as soon as you can.
Paranoia can be a prodcut of many mental disorders. If it is severe I would suggest seeking professional help as soon as you can.
You feel you work to much? This may be something as simple as a mid-life crisis. Perhaps its time for change in your life?
Students often find themselves stressed and exhausted from their studies. I suggest speaking with an academic advisor or mental health professional if this feeling persists.

patterns: how do i know if i'm improving
how do i know my progress
how do i know if i'm getting worse
responses: The road to mental health recovery is anything but straight, you will experience both ups and downs. If this feeling worsens I suggest speaking to a mental health professional.

patterns: what should i do after this
responses: You should contact professional help.
You should contact professional help and ask them about this
You should contact professional help!

patterns: is it hard to become a psychiatrist
how can i become a psychiatrist
can you help me become a psychiatrist
what do i need to become a psychiatrist
what is the best way to become a psychiatrist
responses: To become a psychiatrist it usually takes at least 6 years, you will need your MD and a Diploma to be officially recognized.

patterns: what is it like to be a psychiatrist
what is fun about being psychiatrist
what is the worst part about being a psychiatrist
responses: Being a psychiatrist can be stressful and fun at the same time. There is a always high earnings potential for psychiatrists and an excellent job market. However, the stress that can come from dealing with some clients may outweigh thoes benifits.
Its best if you speak to a real mental health professional about traumatic events as they can be nuanced and many important factors in recovery can be overlooked.
